data.title: :bug: load the bootstrap style for thumbnails
data.body: load the bootstrap style for thumbnails, this fix: #4104

data.title: Dangling Views
data.body:
In my humble opinion, atom > sublime.

Though, in sublime a view only stays open if you make edits. Otherwise, it disappears.  Simple UI, but this is immensely helpful keeping the tab bar uncluttered.

Thanks!

data.title: Tab reorder in linux
data.body:
In Chrome Linux and the Gnome environment (at least Gnome 3), `ctrl-shift-pagedown` and `ctrl-shift-pageup` are shortcuts to reorder tabs.
Here is the Chrome example:
![chrome-tabs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6003742/4966247/a300e9cc-67b7-11e4-96df-7b6f3cfdd8ed.gif)

Anytime I get back to Atom I tried to reorder some tabs just like with Chrome, but it was missing this shortcut. I thought it would be nice to have it. Here is how it looks:
![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6003742/4966259/67bf84a8-67b8-11e4-91c4-c21e056d2fd9.gif)

You may have noticed that Chrome has a nice animation, which I didn't try to implement, but if you would like to have it then let me know what are your thoughts on that so maybe I can start working on it.

Thank you

data.title: UI for per-language settings
data.body: Implement UI (in the settings view) that would allow users to graphically edit the per-language settings that were implemented a few days ago.

data.title: Ask for root password when required
data.body: Some files require root permissions to be edited, but sometimes those files are already modified when one realizes those files require said permissions. It would be nice if Atom could ask for the root password and apply the changes instead of having to close the file, close Atom, open Atom with root privileges and re-edit the file.

data.title: Error while loading shared libraries; Package atom-amd64.deb missing dependencies
data.body:
The application fails to start in the Ubuntu 14.04(Trusty) (in the LinuX Container) - Running the application from the command line shows:
$ atom

> /usr/share/atom/atom: error while loading shared libraries: libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

It seems that the package (downloaded from https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/download/v0.144.0/atom-amd64.deb) has missing dependencies: libgtk2.0-0 libgconf2-4 libasound2 libnss3 libxtst6 (libgnome-keyring0)

$ ldd /usr/share/atom/atom | grep "not found"

>   libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0 => not found
>     libgdk-x11-2.0.so.0 => not found
>     libatk-1.0.so.0 => not found
>     libpangoft2-1.0.so.0 => not found
>     libpangocairo-1.0.so.0 => not found
>     libcairo.so.2 => not found
>     libpango-1.0.so.0 => not found
>     libgdk_pixbuf-2.0.so.0 => not found
>     libgconf-2.so.4 => not found
>     libX11.so.6 => not found
>     libXext.so.6 => not found
>     libXrandr.so.2 => not found
>     libnss3.so => not found
>     libnssutil3.so => not found
>     libsmime3.so => not found
>     libplc4.so => not found
>     libnspr4.so => not found
>     libgconf-2.so.4 => not found
>     libpangocairo-1.0.so.0 => not found
>     libcairo.so.2 => not found
>     libpango-1.0.so.0 => not found
>     libX11.so.6 => not found
>     libXi.so.6 => not found
>     libXcursor.so.1 => not found
>     libXext.so.6 => not found
>     libXfixes.so.3 => not found
>     libXrender.so.1 => not found
>     libXcomposite.so.1 => not found
>     libasound.so.2 => not found
>     libXdamage.so.1 => not found
>     libXtst.so.6 => not found
>     libXrandr.so.2 => not found
>     libcups.so.2 => not found
>     libgdk_pixbuf-2.0.so.0 => not found

$ dpkg -s atom

> Package: atom
> Status: install ok installed
> Priority: optional
> Section: devel
> Installed-Size: 194788
> Maintainer: GitHub atom@github.com
> Architecture: amd64
> Version: 0.144.0
> Depends: python (>= 2.6), libc6
> Description: A hackable text editor for the 21st Century.
>  Atom is a free and open source text editor that is modern, approachable, and hackable to the core.

$ uname -a

> `Linux ntb 3.13.0-39-generic #66-Ubuntu SMP Tue Oct 28 13:30:27 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`

workaround:
$ sudo aptitude install libgtk2.0-0 libgconf2-4 libasound2 libnss3 libxtst6

data.title: Multiple-window menu bug on Windows
data.body:
On Windows only, when I open multiple Atom windows, then jump from one window's menu to the other window's menu, the menu actions affect the former window.  It should affect the latter window.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open two windows in Atom.
2. In Window 1, click the "View" menu.  Leave it open.
3. In Window 2, click the "View" menu.  The menu in Window 1 will close when you click it.
4. Click something like, say, "View -> Developer -> Toggle Developer Tools".  The tools are toggled on Window 1, even though you clicked the item in Window 2.

I noticed this problem while looking at https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/issues/802.  In that case, I noticed that I could open two Atom windows, launch "File -> Open File..." in Window 2, then apparently open Window 2's menu by first clicking on Window 1's menu.  Selecting something in Window 2's apparent menu actually affects Window 1.

data.title: Atom's title doesn't display the correct directory
data.body:
**Atom version:** 0.144.0
**OS:** Windows 8

I opened 4 different files, all in different directories. However, the window's title (e.g. Atom application's title) stay the same regardless which file I'm looking at. The following screenshots should give better idea of the issue I encountered.

![screenshot_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3465543/4965641/1ad3a46a-678d-11e4-9aa5-b70d427b7ed0.PNG)

Please consider it ,it may be a bug.

data.title: Native Chromium scrollbars after reload
data.body:
Whenever I reload Atom with a file opened that triggered a scrollbar, native Chromium scrollbars will appear until another file/tab has been used. For Windows, it only appears to be the vertical scrollbar. In Ubuntu also the horizontal scrollbar loses styling. 

![atom-scrollbar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8148535/4965025/aca0ad0c-6779-11e4-817b-597338fef281.gif)

Seems similar to #4090, but this is without shadow DOM enabled, and also happens when using `atom --safe`. Also no errors in the console.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open a long file in Atom that causes a scrollbar to appear
2. Choose View > Reload
### Details

Theme: Atom Dark
Safe mode: verified
Atom version:
- 0.144.0 on Windows 8.1 x64, not using Chocolatey
- 0.142.0 on Ubuntu 14.10

data.title: Make deserialization of the active pane more tolerant and add assertions to catch invalid states
Find and Replace hotkey triggers replacement action when replace field is empty
data.body:
1. Press Cmd-Shift-F to open find and replace panel
2. Type in a search term
3. Press Cmd-enter

... at this point Atom replaced all references of the search term with _nothing_ (effectively wiping all the references of the search term).

IMO Cmd-enter should do nothing (or the same thing as just enter) if nothing has been entered into the replacement field.

I tested this with `0.143.0` on Yosemite.

Ref atom/find-and-replace#289

data.title: Fix user stylesheet regression due to shadow DOM PR
data.body: The solution for rendering global style tags with the shadow DOM disabled disrupted the order of the cascade. This is a different approach that preserves it.

data.title: Packages with a context-specific stylesheet and normal sheet: normal sheet is not loaded
data.body:
With shadow DOM turned on. 

This is such a package: https://github.com/atom/decoration-example

The `decoration-example.less` file is not loaded. Removing the `decoration-example.atom-text-editor.less` file fixes.

data.title: Folding broken after splitting
data.body:
- Open an editor
- Fold a function
- Split the pane
- Unfold the function in the new pane
- Fold something inside the initially folded function
- Gutter shows it as folded but is isn't

![fold-split](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/4959970/29b5be8e-66be-11e4-978e-2a0c8ceb4569.gif)

data.title: Close Pane closes Tabs despite Cancel
data.body:
In a window with several tabs, some of them _dirty_, using Close Pane (from File menu) pops the "Changes will be lost" dialog. However clicking the Cancel button still closes the _untouched_ tabs. 

Expected behaviour: do not close anything.

Additionally, clicking Cancel should also immediately stop the processing of the command. At the moment it carries on prompting for each _dirty_ tab.

data.title: Tree view show files greyed out that should not be greyed out
data.body:
Freshly checking out a project I'm working on via `git clone https://git.swift.im/review/swift` and opening it via `open -a "Atom" swift` it shows all source files (.cpp/.h) under Swift/QtUI as greyed out ( https://www.dropbox.com/s/hpb089qah49itsl/Screenshot%202014-11-07%2019.04.41.png ), as if they were covered by .gitignore, but they aren't. This also prevents them to be easily opened via `CMD+P`.

OS: OS X 10.9.5
Atom Version: 0.141.0

data.title: Closing pane clobbers unsaved files
data.body:
Closing a pane closes unsaved files without prompting or saving
- **Atom Version:**       0.143.0-b29a61e
- **Atom-Shell Version:** 0.19.1
- **OS Version:**         Mac OS X 10.10
- **Misc Versions**
  - apm  0.109.0
  - npm  1.4.4
  - node 0.10.32
  - python 2.7.6
  - git 2.1.2
## Repro Steps
1. Open a file `a.txt`
2. Open second pane <kbd>Cmd+K RIGHT</kbd>
3. Open a file `b.txt`
4. Make a change to `b.txt`
5. Select `File | Close Pane`

**Expected:** Dialog is shown
**Actual:** No dialog is shown, file is closed without prompting

---

<small>This report was created in and posted from the Atom editor using the package `bug-report` version 0.4.1.</small>

data.title: Atom takes over global unicode insertion by using CTRL+SHIFT+U
data.body: On Linux (Ubuntu, Debian, GNOME, Unity... Maybe Fedora too because it uses GNOME)  Ctrl+Shift+U is a global keyboard command that activates Unicode insertion (even in Atom Editor.)  By taking over a global keyboard command you have removed my ability to insert Unicode.  Please, can the keyboard command be changed?  I've already remapped mine out since I don't need it but...

data.title: Cancel is ignored when closing window with unsaved changes
data.body:
It looks like the same issue as #1989.

I'm runing 0.142.0 on Windows 7.

I've tracked it down to three 'beforeunload' handlers being called, one of them honoring the Cancel request but only to have its result flag trampled by the third handler. Could not go further for now.

It behaves as if "Don't Save" was chosen. :scream: 

(Dismissing the dialog using the close icon does the same, as you would expect.)

data.title: Chrome integration
data.body:
This is a really long shot and maybe kind of a crazy idea, but... is it possible to accept dragged Chrome tabs and show them into panes?

I mean, the same way two Chrome windows can accept a dragged tab (drag a tab from one window to another), Atom could accept Chrome tabs and show them.

Is that possible?
